text: the u.s. said it was targeting an
Islamic state tunnel complex when it
dropped one of the largest non-nuclear
bombs and its arsenal over a remote part
of Afghanistan on Thursday the area is
an achene in the country's eastern
province of Nanga har along the border
of Pakistan it is considered a
stronghold of Isis's leadership and is
thought to have been where foreign
fighters live and factions came to
pledge allegiance to the group
although the Taliban pose a much bigger
threat and exist in far greater numbers
in Afghanistan the US has said defeating
Isis in the country is a priority this
year and an intense air campaign has
continued the spring with more than 100
airstrikes already in April but Afghan
ground forces have not been able to
advance on the Isis stronghold because
the terrain is largely inaccessible so
they asks the US for airstrikes
however this was the first time that we
encountered an extensive obstacle to our
progress that was constituted by the
belts of IEDs the presence of tunnels
and caves and therefore this was the
appropriate weapon to use at this time
to reduce that obstacle Afghan officials
estimate between 30 to 18 militants were
killed in the bombing the ISIS of
shooting Afghanistan is also known as
Isis and Khorasan province the group
consists of former Pakistani Taliban
fighters former members of the Afghan
Taliban as well as vex and Central
Asians it had rapidly expanded in
eastern Afghanistan from 2015 in early
2016 US military officials estimated the
group had between two three thousand
fighters across 11 districts but after
multiple airstrikes and military
operations it decreased to seven hundred
fighters across three districts as the
group has lost territory it has claimed
more attacks in urban centers including
a deadly suicide bombings in Kabul and
the storming of the city's marginal
hospital earlier this year
so it's unclear whether the group is
directly responsible for all those
recent attacks
